title: Philadelphia reaches $9.25m settlement over 2020 police response
description: More than 340 plaintiffs were awarded $9.25m over police violence during 2020 George Floyd protests.

title: Hong Kong struggles to win back tourists, ‘World City’ crown
description: Chinese territory welcomed just 500,000 visitors in January, compared to 6.8 million arrivals in 2019.

title: What does a possible indictment mean for Trump’s re-election bid?
description: Trump is expected to see short-term bump as indictment plays into long-held claims of being unjustly targeted.

title: Four members of Oath Keepers convicted for January 6 involvement
description: Decision comes as federal prosecutors make final arguments against Proud Boys members accused of seditious conspiracy.

title: Has the UN’s process to meet climate goals been effective?
description: UN report on climate change warns of an 'avalanche of disasters'.

title: Putin says ready to discuss China’s Ukraine plan at Xi talks
description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping visits Moscow days after the ICC issued an arrest warrant for Russia President Vladimir Putin.

title: IMF approves Sri Lanka’s $2.9bn bailout
description: Loan clears the way for release of funds and kicks off a four-year programme designed to shore up the country's economy.

title: French gov’t survives no-confidence votes over pension reform
description: Lawmakers table two motions to protest against President Macron's decision to bypass parliament to raise retirement age.

title: EU ministers agree to send Ukraine one million artillery shells
description: EU defence and foreign ministers backed an initiative aimed at providing Ukraine with one million artillery shells.

title: US says all sides committed war crimes in Ethiopia conflict
description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken says Ethiopian, Eritrean and Amhara forces committed crimes against humanity.

title: Mothers emerge as leaders in Cuban resistance movement
description: Matriarchs are often seen leading protests on the Caribbean island beset by widespread discontent, economic hardships.

title: UN calls for rapid, ambitious action to tackle climate crisis
description: New IPCC report says there are enough resources and knowledge to tackle the global climate crisis.

title: Somalia drought may have killed 43,000 in 2022, half under 5: UN
description: After five consecutive failed rainy seasons, rate of fatalities could rise in first half of 2023, research finds.

title: After Cyclone Freddy’s devastation, cholera fears rise in Malawi
description: Storm has destroyed water systems and toilets, sparking concerns the country's deadliest cholera outbreak will worsen.

title: After arrest warrant for Putin, Russia opens case against ICC
description: Russia says the ICC has knowingly accused an innocent person of a crime, in another show of defiance against the court.

title: Northern Ireland’s DUP to vote against new Brexit deal with EU
description: In blow to Prime Minister Sunak, Unionist leader says 'imposition of EU law' on Northern Ireland has not been resolved.

title: French journalist Dubois freed after 23-month abduction in Mali
description: Olivier Dubois has been held by armed groups since he went missing in the Sahel in 2021.

title: Legacy of the Iraq War

title: Nepal PM wins confidence vote in parliament
description: Vote was called after Pushpa Kamal Dahal's old coalition allies pulled out of government over choice of new president.

title: What happened when Iraq was invaded 20 years ago?
description: It has been 20 years since the US-led invasion of Iraq, Al Jazeera breaks down some of the war's defining moments.

title: The Imprisonment of Julian Assange

title: Ancient pearl town discovered in United Arab Emirates

title: Palestinians ‘an invention’ of past century: Israel’s Smotrich

title: Analysis: Iran’s influence prevents Iraq’s Arab reintegration
description: Ties between Iraq and the Gulf Arab monarchies have warmed in recent years, but Iran ultimately has more influence.

title: Kenyan police fire tear gas, arrest opposition figures at protest

title: An ICC warrant against Putin is good – and hypocritical

title: Houthi rebels: 15 Saudis to be released in Yemen prisoner swap
description: Yemeni government and Houthis say more than 800 prisoners will be exchanged in total, after UN-mediated talks.

title: ‘Point of no return’: UN report to provide stark climate warning

description: The pre-sunrise to sunset fast lasts anywhere from 12 to 18 hours, depending on where in the world you are.

title: N Korea’s Kim led drills ‘simulating nuclear counterattack’: KCNA
